SUBRECIPIENT:SUBAWARDEES WILL DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT PLACED-BASED INTERACTIVE LESSONS TO CREATE A MULTI-SITE REGIONAL NETWORK FOR PROMOTING CLIMATE LITERACY THROUGHOUT APPALACHIAN OHIO, OUTCOMES:IT IS ANTICIPATED THAT THIS PROJECT WILL RESULT IN THE FOLLOWING DELIVERABLES: DEVELOPMENT OF NEW CURRICULAR MATERIALS INCLUDING VIRTUAL LESSONS, CREATION OF A STORY MAP AND RESOURCES FOR WEBINARS. 

EXPECTED OUTCOMES OF THE PROJECT INCLUDE: PRE- SERVICE TEACHERS WILL DEVELOP INCREASED CLIMATE LITERACY AND CAPACITY, INCREASED NUMBER OF APPALACHIAN STUDENTS PARTICIPATING IN APPALACHIAN STEM ENRICHMENT ACADEMY AND INCREASED CAPACITY FOR ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION THROUGHOUT RURAL OHIO WHICH WILL ALL BENEFIT COMMUNITIES IN RURAL APPALACHIA.

DESCRIPTION:THE FRIENDS OF THE CHICAGO RIVER WILL DESIGN, DEMONSTRATE, AND DISSEMINATE ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION PRACTICES, METHODS, AND TECHNIQUES, THAT WILL SERVE TO INCREASE ENVIRONMENTAL LITERACY AND ENCOURAGE BEHAVIOR THAT WILL BENEFIT THE ENVIRONMENT IN THE CHICAGO-CALUMET RIVER WATERSHED. THE GRANTEE WILL BUILD UPON PREVIOUSLY-FUNDED WORK BY BOLSTERING PROGRAM OUTREACH IN UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES, PARTNERING WITH SCHOOLS TO EXPAND THEIR CAPACITY TO ENGAGE WITH THE RIVER AS A SITE FOR STEM LEARNING, AND EMPOWERING DIVERSE COMMUNITIES TO ENGAGE WITH ENVIRONMENTAL CONCEPTS.ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED DURING THIS PROJECT PERIOD INCLUDE DEVELOPING PRESENTATIONS, SHARING CURRICULUM, HOSTING WORKSHOPS AND CONDUCTING FIELDTRIPS TO THE CHICAGO RIVER.SUBRECIPIENT:SUB AWARDS WILL SUPPORT TEACHER ENGAGEMENT IN THE NETWORK THROUGH STIPENDS TO SUPPORT TEACHER TRAINING, WORKSHOP ATTENDANCE, CURRICULUM MANAGEMENT, AND PURCHASING LEARNING MATERIALS THAT SUPPORT BOTH LABORATORY AND FIELD LEARNING..OUTCOMES:DELIVERABLES INCLUDE CONDUCTING OUTREACH AND PROGRAMMING WITH SCHOOL DISTRICTS, HOSTING TEACHER WORKSHOPS AND STEWARDSHIP FIELD TRIPS.  EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE A DEEPER APPRECIATION OF THE CHICAGO RIVER, INCREASED INTEREST IN SCIENCE, TECHNOLOGY, MATHEMATICS AND ENGINEERING FIELDS AND INTEREST IN BECOMING A STEWARD OF THE RIVER. OUTCOMES WILL BENEFIT STUDENTS, TEACHERS AND COMMUNITY MEMBERS IN THE CHICAGO-CALUMET RIVER WATERSHED.

DESCRIPTION:THIS PROJECT PROVIDES FUNDING TO MN STATE UNIVERSITY TO IMPLEMENT ITS PROJECT, WHICH WILL DESIGN, DEMONSTRATE, AND DISSEMINATE ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION PRACTICES, METHODS, AND TECHNIQUES, THAT WILL SERVE TO INCREASE ENVIRONMENTAL LITERACY AND ENCOURAGE BEHAVIOR THAT WILL BENEFIT THE ENVIRONMENT. THE GRANTEE WILL DO THIS BY EDUCATING STUDENTS AND TEACHERS IN AND AROUND MINNEAPOLIS, MN ABOUT AIR QUALITY MONITORING. ACTIVITIES:THIS PROJECT WILL INCREASE PUBLIC AWARENESS AND KNOWLEDGE ABOUT ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES IN AND AROUND MINNEAPOLIS MN AND PROVIDE STUDENTS AND TEACHERS SKILLS NECESSARY TO MAKE INFORMED DECISIONS AND TO TAKE RESPONSIBLE ACTIONS. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED DURING THIS PROJECT PERIOD INCLUDE: DEVELOPING AIR QUALITY MONITORING PROJECTS, EDUCATING UNDERGRADUATE STUDENTS ON AIR QUALITY MEASUREMENTS, EDUCATING HIGH-SCHOOL/COMMUNITY COLLEGE FACULTY AND HELPING THEM TO CREATE AIR QUALITY LESSON PLANS.
SUBRECIPIENT:SUB AWARDS WILL BE USED FOR PAYING FOR THE TEACHER/FACULTY TIME THAT IS ASSOCIATED WITH (1) GENERATING AIR QUALITY AND AIR QUALITY MONITORING PROJECT LESSONS FOR STUDENTS IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE PI, (2) DEPLOYING THOSE LESSONS, (3) SUPERVISING STUDENTS' AIR QUALITY MONITORING PROJECTS, AND(4) ATTENDING THE COMMUNITY MEETINGS ASSOCIATED WITH THE PRESENTATION OF THE RESULTS.OUTCOMES:IT IS ANTICIPATED THAT THIS PROJECT WILL RESULT IN THE FOLLOWING DELIVERABLES: DEVELOPMENT OF  AIR QUALITY MONITORING PROJECTS, DEPLOYMENT OF LESSON PLANS AND SHARING RESULTS OF MONITORING PROJECTS. EXPECTED OUTCOMES OF THE PROJECT INCLUDE: INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF BENEFITS AND LIMITATIONS OF USING LOW COST AIR QUALITY SENSORS AND ENGINEERING STUDENTS HAVING A BETTER UNDERSTANDING OF WORKING WITH AIR MONITORS IN UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES.

DESCRIPTION:THIS PROJECT PROVIDES FUNDING TO UNIVERSITY OF IL AT CHICAGO TO IMPLEMENT ITS PROJECT, WHICH WILL DESIGN, DEMONSTRATE, AND DISSEMINATE ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION PRACTICES, METHODS, AND TECHNIQUES, THAT WILL SERVE TO INCREASE ENVIRONMENTAL LITERACY AND ENCOURAGE BEHAVIOR THAT WILL BENEFIT THE ENVIRONMENT IN METROPOLITAN CHICAGO. THE GRANTEE WILL DO THIS BY PREPARING FUTURE PUBLIC HEALTH PROFESSIONALS AND COMMUNITY MEMBERS TO ADDRESS THE PUBLIC HEALTH IMPACTS FROM CLIMATE CHANGE THROUGH A 2-YEAR TRAINING PROGRAM; AND 2) TO INCREASE KNOWLEDGE AND AWARENESS, AMONG CIVIC LEADERS AND COMMUNITY MEMBERS IN ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE COMMUNITIES ABOUT CLIMATE CHANGE, PUBLIC HEALTH IMPACTS, AND STRATEGIES TO ADDRESS IT.ACTIVITIES:THIS PROJECT WILL INCREASE PUBLIC AWARENESS AND KNOWLEDGE ABOUT ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES METROPOLITAN CHICAGO, SPECIFICALLY THE MUNICIPALITIES OF WAUKEGAN, CHICAGO HEIGHTS, AURORA, HANOVER PARK,. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED DURING THIS PROJECT INCLUDE 1) ASSESSING BOTH COMMUNITY PARTNERS', CIVIC LEADERS AND COMMUNITY MEMBERS KNOWLEDGE AND AWARENESS ON CLIMATE CHANGE, ITS PUBLIC HEALTH IMPACTS, AND ACTIONS TO SLOW DOWN CLIMATE CHANGE AND MITIGATE CLIMATE-RELATED DISASTERS 2) DEVELOPING AND DISSEMINATING CLIMATE AND HEALTH CURRICULUM 3) WORKING WITH COMMUNITY PARTNERS ON PROJECTS AND 4) SHARING PROJECTS. SUBRECIPIENT:THE SUBRECIPIENTS WILL BE PART OF DEVELOPING AND DELIVERING THE CURRICULUM IN YEAR 1. STUDENTS WILL BE PLACED WITH A SUBRECIPIENT IN YEAR 2 AND WORK ON A PROJECT FOR THE SUBRECIPIENT,
COMMUNITY MEMBERS, AND CIVIC LEADERS.OUTCOMES:IT IS ANTICIPATED THAT THIS PROJECT WILL RESULT IN THE FOLLOWING DELIVERABLES:
1)10 STUDENTS AND UP TO 30 COMMUNITY MEMBERS WILL INCREASE KNOWLEDGE AND AWARENESS OF CLIMATE CHANGE, HEALTH, ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE, STEWARDSHIP OPPORTUNITIES TO ADDRESS
CLIMATE CHANGE, AND IMPROVE THEIR SKILLSET TO ADDRESS CLIMATE CHANGE.
2)  REACHING 400 CIVIC LEADERS FROM 24 ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE COMMUNITIES, AND 334,813 COMMUNITY MEMBERS FROM ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE COMMUNITIES WILL INCREASE KNOWLEDGE AND
AWARENESS OF CLIMATE CHANGE, HEALTH, ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE, STEWARDSHIP OPPORTUNITIES TO ADDRESS CLIMATE CHANGE, AND IMPROVE THEIR SKILLSET TO ADDRESS CLIMATE CHANGE. 
3) REDUCE NEGATIVE HEALTH EFFECTS LINKED TO CLIMATE CHANGE IN ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE COMMUNITIES AND INCREASE CLIMATE RESILIENCY IN ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE COMMUNITIES.
ALL DELIVERABLES WILL BENEFIT COMMUNITIES IN METROPOLITAN CHICAGO.

THE UNIVERSITY OF WISCONSIN-MADISON ARBORETUM AND SEVERAL PARTNERS WILL WORK WITH LEADERS AND RESIDENTS IN THE LAKE WINGRA WATERSHED TO ACHIEVE THE GOAL OF MINIMIZING HARMFUL EFFECTS OF STORMWATER THAT FLOWS FROM URBAN LAND INTO LAKES AND RIVERS. THE PROJECT WILL ENGAGE 15-20 LEADERS 'SOCIAL TRAILBLAZERS' AND FURTHER ENGAGE INDIVIDUALS AND POLICY MAKERS. OUTREACH WILL BE CONDUCTED USING CUSTOMIZABLE TOOLKITS, ONLINE TRAINING, A WEBSITE AND COMMUNITY EVENTS. MORE THAN 6,500 RESIDENTS AND INDIVIDUALS WILL BE REACHED.

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO CENTRAL MICHIGAN UNIVERSITY TO IMPLEMENT THE H20 Q PROGRAM. THE PROGRAM IS A PLACE-BASED ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION (EE) EXPERIENCE THAT WILL ENGAGE TEACHERS, COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS, AND CORPORATE AND PUBLIC PARTNERS IN EXPERIENTIAL FIELD SCIENCE TO HELP STUDENTS MEASURE WATER QUALITY PARAMETERS, SCIENTIFICALLY ANALYZE AND CRITICALLY APPLY THIS DATA TO A LOCAL ISSUE AFFECTING THE GREAT LAKES, THEN MAKE PLANS, AND TAKE ACTION.

THIS GRANT AGREEMENT PROVIDES FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO THE ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION ASSOCIATION OF ILLINOIS TO IMPLEMENT THE EARTH FORCE ILLINOIS PROGRAM. THE PROGRAM PREPARES K12 EDUCATORS IN ILLINOIS TO DESIGN AND IMPLEMENT STUDENT-LED ENVIRONMENTAL ACTION PROJECTS THAT ENSURE CLEAN AND SAFE WATER, ENSURE THE SAFETY OF CHEMICALS AND REVITALIZE LAND.

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO NEIGHBORHOOD HOUSE OF MILWAUKEE TO IMPLEMENT THE RENEW-RECYCLE-RECLAIM: LEAD & LEARN LAND REVITALIZATION EDUCATION PROGRAM. THE PROGRAM IS SHAPED BY TWO GOALS: 1) TO INCREASE ACCESS TO ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE EDUCATION AND MEANINGFUL CONSERVATION ACTIVITIES WITH A FOCUS ON LAND REVITALIZATION, WATER QUALITY AND AIR QUALITY FOR MORE THAN 1,000 LOW-INCOME, URBAN YOUTH OF COLOR, AGES 6-19; AND 2) TO PROVIDE 14 PAID INTERNSHIPS AND HIGH QUALITY JOB TRAINING AND WORK EXPERIENCES TO DIVERSE, DISADVANTAGED, URBAN HIGH SCHOOL/COLLEGE STUDENTS INTERESTED IN NATURAL RESOURCES DEGREES AND EMPLOYMENT.

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO TROUT UNLIMITED TO IMPLEMENT THE EXPANSION OF STREAM GIRLS PROGRAM. THE  PROGRAM WILL EDUCATE MORE THAN 275 GIRLS, 35 PARTNERS AND VOLUNTEERS, AND 1,000 COMMUNITY MEMBERS FROM ACROSS MICHIGAN.THEY LEARN TO INVESTIGATE A STREAM, COMMUNICATE WHAT THEY FIND, AND THEN BECOME STEWARDS BY VOLUNTEERING TO DESIGN AND IMPLEMENT PROJECTS TO PROTECT WATER QUALITY.

THIS PROJECT WILL LEVERAGE THE REGIONAL CONSERVATION PARTNERSHIP PROGRAM (RCPP) WITH EPA ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION FUNDING TO BUILD A FOUNDATION FOR A MULTI-FACETED CONSERVATION OUTREACH APPROACH PARTNERING WITH SCHOOLS, A SUSTAINABLY MANAGED COMMUNITY SUPPORTED AGRICULTURE FARM, AND LARGE-SCALE CROPPING FARMERS TO 1) IDENTIFY AND ADDRESS NUTRIENT AND SEDIMENT NONPOINT SOURCE POLLUTION, 2) ADDRESS THE NEED TO PROTECT AND RESTORE BOTH GREEN SPACES AND THE GRAND RIVER AND 3) USE DIVERSE INNOVATIVE TECHNOLOGIES, INTERACTIVE EXPERIENTIAL LEARNING OPPORTUNITIES, AND CONSERVATION PRACTICE DEMONSTRATIONS TO ENGAGE NON-TRADITIONAL LANDOWNERS TO IMPLEMENT BEST MANAGEMENT PRACTICES.

THIS GRANT AGREEMENT TO THE SOUTHERN ILLINOIS UNIVERSITY - EDWARDSVILLE PROVIDES FUNDING TO THE UNIVERSITY TO INCREASES EDUCATION AND TRAINING OPTIONS AS WELL AS PUBLIC AWARENESS AND KNOWLEDGE ABOUT THREE CRITICAL CLEAN WATER ISSUES: REGULATED POLLUTANTS; EMERGING POLLUTANTS AND BIOLOGICAL CONTAMINATION, WITH A GOAL OF PROVIDING ACCESS TO TRANSPARENT, PUBLIC SOURCES OF DATA AND INFORMATION TO ALLOW COMMUNITY MEMBERS AND COMMUNITIES TO MAKE INFORMED DECISIONS AND TAKE RESPONSIBLE ACTIONS.

THE 'PUTTING THE 'CLEAR WATER' BACK IN THE EAU CLAIRE RIVER - CULTIVATING COMMUNITY CAPACITY FOR HEALTHY SOILS AND HEALTHY WATERS' PROJECT WILL BUILD COMMUNITY CAPACITY FOR THE ADOPTION OF FARMING PRINCIPLES AND PRACTICES THAT INCREASE BIODIVERSITY, ENRICH SOILS, IMPROVE SURFACE AND GROUNDWATER QUALITY, AND ENHANCE ECOSYSTEM SERVICES WITHIN THE EAU CLAIRE RIVER WATERSHED.

THE CONNECT, EXPLORE, AND ENGAGE:  BRIDGING THE EE OPPORTUNITY GAP USING PUBLIC LANDS PROJECT WILL BUILD CAPACITY FOR SUSTAINABLE ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION INITIATIVES IN 5 RURAL SCHOOL DISTRICTS ACROSS WISCONSIN, REACHING UP TO 1,250 STUDENTS.

THE FRIENDS OF THE CHICAGO RIVER WILL TARGET TEACHERS AND STUDENTS THROUGH THIS PROJECT TO ULTIMATELY INCREASE ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION OF THE CHICAGO RIVER. THE GOAL FOR TEACHERS IS TO DEVELOP ENVIRONMENTAL LITERACY AND TRAIN THEM TO COMMUNICATE ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES ASSOCIATED WITH THE CHICAGO RIVER. THE GOAL FOR STUDENTS IS TO INSPIRE THE NEXT GENERATION OF ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDS THROUGH PLACE-BASED EXPERIENTIAL LEARNING.

THE PROJECT WILL INCREASE AWARENESS AND KNOWLEDGE AMONG STUDENTS ABOUT ENVIRONMENTAL AND CONSERVATION ISSUES THAT IMPACT THE COMMUNITY AND SOUTHEASTERN WISCONSIN, AS WELL AS INTRODUCE AND PROMOTE NATURAL RESOURCES CAREERS TO LOW-INCOME AND MINORITY HIGH SCHOOL AND COLLEGE STUDENTS. PROJECT ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE TRAININGS AND WORKSHOPS AS WELL AS HANDS-ON EXPLORATIONS OF LOCAL FLORA AND FAUNA.

THE PROJECT WILL CONNECT EDUCATORS AND STUDENTS IN THE MILWAUKEE METROPOLITAN AREA WITH THE TRAINING AND TOOLS NECESSARY TO ENGAGE IN HANDS-ON ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION AND WATER QUALITY MONITORING. PROJECT ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE SCIENCE FAIRS, SUMMITS AND TRAINING WORKSHOPS. THESE ACTIVITIES WILL EMPOWER STUDENTS AND TEACHERS IN MILWAUKEE TO CRITICALLY ANALYZE ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES, SOLVE PROBLEMS IN THEIR COMMUNITIES, AND MAKE IMPORTANT DECISIONS ABOUT WATER QUALITY.

THIS GRANT AGREEMENT FUNDS THE RECYCLING PARTNERSHIP FOR THE EMPOWERING MINNESOTA RESIDENTS TO RECYCLE MORE AND BETTER PROJECT.  THE PROJECT WILL INCREASE PUBLIC AWARENESS AND ACTION ON RECYCLING ACROSS THE STATE OF MINNESOTA.  OUTREACH PROJECTS WILL INCLUDE WEBINARS, WORKSHOPS, AND CURRICULUM VIDEOS FOR TEACHERS AND OTHER INSTRUCTORS.

THE CHICAGO HORTICULTURAL SOCIETY'S SCIENCE FIRST AND COLLEGE FIRST PROJECT WILL ENGAGE STUDENTS IN AN ENVIRONMENTAL CURRICULUM, PARTNERING WITH FIVE CHICAGO ORGANIZATIONS SO THAT STUDENTS WORK WITH ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE AND COMMUNITY PROFESSIONALS, EDUCATING THE COMMUNITY ABOUT ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES AND STRATEGIES FOR COMMUNITY LEAD CHANGE.

THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $100,000 TO THE NORTH CAROLINA FOUNDATION FOR SOIL AND WATER CONSERVATION TO HELP IMPROVE PEOPLE UNDERSTANDING OF NATURAL RESOURCE MANAGEMENT AND ITS IMPACT ON ECOSYSTEM SERVICES AND ENCOURAGE LONG TERM BEHAVIORAL CHANGES THAT POSITIVELY IMPACT WATER QUALITY AND SOIL HEALTH.

THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $100,000 TO TROY UNIVERSITY TO HELP PROMOTE ENVIRONMENTAL AND CONSERVATION STEWARDSHIP IN UNDERREPRESENTED COMMUNITIES THROUGH AN INFORMAL ENVIRONMENTAL MENTORING INITIATIVE. STUDENTS WILL EXERCISE THEIR CREATIVITY BY EGAGING IN ENVIRONMENTAL PROBLEM-SOLVING DESIGN, SOLUTION IMPLEMENTATION, AND INTERPRETATION.

THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $100,000 TO THE THE EDUCATION FUND INCORPORATION TO HELP CREATE, EXPAND AND/OR SOLIDIFY FOOD FORESTS IN 25 ELEMENTARY SCHOOLS IN MIAMI-DADE COUNTY. THEIR EFFORTS WILL FOSTER AND SUPPORT COMMUNITY AWARENESS AND STEWARDSHIP OF THE FRAGILE SOUTH FLORIDA ENVIRONMENT.

THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $100,000 TO THE TRUST FOR PUBLIC LAND. THE FUNDS WILL HELP INFORM RESIDENTS OF WATER-QUALITY RELATED ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES AND HELP INCREASE TRANSPARENCY IN THE DESIGN OF GREEN SPACES THROUGH COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT USING STUDENT FOCUSED EDUCATIONAL ACTIVITIES AND STUDENT COMMUNITY ENVIRONMENTAL EXPERIENCES.

THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $100,000 TO THE UNIVERSITY OF NORTH GEORGIA. THE FUNDS WILL HELP THE UNIVERSITY PROMOTE RESPONSIBLE, SUSTAINABLE ACTIONS IN THE CARE AND CONSERVATION OF NATIVE FOREST ECOSYSTEMS IN NORTH GEORGIA. STUDENTS AND MEMBERS OF THE PUBLIC WILL ASSESS WATER QUALITY, TREE HEALTH, APPLY CHEMICALS SUSTAINABLY, AND IDENTIFY NATIVE/INVASIVE SPECIES DURING WORKSHOPS.

THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $62,001 TO APPALACHIAN STATE UNIVERSITY. THE FUNDS WILL HELP INCREASE THE COMMUNITY UNDERSTANDING OF WATER QUALITY ISSUES AND HELP THE COMMUNITY PARTICIPATE IN ENVIRONMENTAL AND CONSERVATION STEWARDSHIP THROUGH COMMUNITY COLLABORATION ON WATER QUALITY ISSUES.

THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $91,000 TO BIRMINGHAM ZOO, INC. WHICH WILL ENABLE THEM TO PROVIDE ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION PROGRAMMING TO THE BIRMINGHAM COMMUNITY VIA IT'S ZOOSCHOOL PROGRAM, AS WELL AS OTHER EDUCATIONAL INITIATIVES LED BY IT'S EDUCATION DEPARTMENT STAFF. ZOOSCHOOL IS A HANDS-ON INITIATIVE OFFERED AT NO COST TO PARTICIPATING PUBLIC SCHOOL STUDENTS AND THEIR TEACHERS. THE PROGRAM IS CARRIED OUT OVER 20 WEEKS. EACH WEEK FOR 20 WEEKS PER YEAR, A NEW COHORT OF 40 STUDENTS AND TWO TEACHERS WILL ARRIVE AT THE ZOO TO TAKE PART IN FIVE DAYS OF EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMMING THAT ADDRESSES A VARIETY OF ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES SUCH AS WATER CONSERVATION, RECYCLING, AGRICULTURE, SPECIES ENDANGERMENT AND OTHER RELATED TOPICS.

THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $91,000 TO THE CAPTAIN PLANET FOUNDATION WHICH WILL ENABLE THE FOUNDATION TO STRENGTHEN THE FIELD OF ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION BY TRANSFORMING THE WAY SCIENCE IS TAUGHT IN SCHOOLS, AND EMPOWERING THE NEXT GENERATION OF ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDS BY DEVELOPNG AND PROVIDING A REPLICABLE MODEL THAT ENCOMPASES EXEMPLARY CURRICULUM MATERIALS, PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT FOR EDUCATORS, SUPPLIES AND MATERIALS KITS, WHILE MENTORING TO ASSIST WITH THE IMPLEMENTATION OF THE PROGRAM.

DESCRIPTION:THIS PROJECT PROVIDES FUNDING TO LAKE CHAMPLAIN MARITIME MUSEUM TO IMPLEMENT ITS PROJECT, WHICH WILL DESIGN, DEMONSTRATE, AND DISSEMINATE ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION PRACTICES, METHODS, AND TECHNIQUES, THAT WILL SERVE TO INCREASE ENVIRONMENTAL LITERACY AND ENCOURAGE BEHAVIOR THAT WILL BENEFIT THE ENVIRONMENT IN  FERRISBURGH, VERGENNES, AND BRANDON, VERMONT. THE GRANTEE WILL DO THIS BY WORKING WITH LOCAL PARTNERS INCLUDING VERMONT FISH AND WILDLIFE DEPARTMENT AND THE VERMONT DEPARTMENT OF FORESTS, PARKS AND RECREATION ON PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT AND IMPLEMENTATION INCLUDING TOOLS, RESOURCES AND EDUCATION CONTENT INCLUDING NEW LESSON PLANS ON HOW TO USE THE GIANT MAP AS AN ENGAGING LEARNING RESOURCE. ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED DURING THIS PROJECT PERIOD INCLUDE: TRAINING FOR 50 TEACHERS AT 5 TITLE 1 SCHOOLS ON ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION (EE) AND HOW TO USE THE GIANT MAP; GIANT MAP PROGRAMMING FOR STUDENTS LED BY MUSEUM STAFF AND PARTNERS; AND GIANT MAP PROGRAMMING LED BY TEACHERS AT 5 TITLE 1 SCHOOLS AND CONNECT STUDENTS WITH ENVIRONMENTAL PROFESSIONAL ON CAREER OPPORTUNITIES. THE MUSEUM WILL WORK WITH LOCAL PARTNERS TO CONNECT TEACHERS WITH RESOURCES. STAFF FROM THE VT FISH AND WILDLIFE DEPARTMENT AND THE VT DEPARTMENT OF FORESTS, PARKS, AND RECREATION WILL PARTNER ON PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT AND IMPLEMENTATION. SUBRECIPIENT:SUBAWARDS WILL BE GIVEN TO ENTITIES TO PERFORM TASKS INTEGRAL TO THE PROJECT'S GOALS, AS OUTLINED BY THE PRIME. THIS SPECIFIC GRANT WILL AWARD SUBAWARDS TO 2 SCHOOL DISTRICTS FOR COSTS FOR TEACHERS TO PARTICIPATE IN TEACHER TRAININGS AND A UNIVERSITY TO PROVIDE PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT CREDIT.  OUTCOMES:IT IS ANTICIPATED THAT THIS PROJECT WILL RESULT IN THE FOLLOWING DELIVERABLES: 2 NEW LESSON PLANS TO BE USED WITH THE GIANT MAP, TEACHER TRAINING AND SITE VISITS TO SCHOOLS WITH THE GIANT MAP. EXPECTED OUTCOMES OF THE PROJECT INCLUDE: INCREASE UNDERSTANDING OF SPATIAL/ECOLOGICAL RELATIONSHIPS BETWEEN DISTANCE CORNERS OF THE WATERSHED AND LAKE CHAMPLAIN, DEVELOP NEW PERSPECTIVES ON HOW STUDENTS CAN POSITIVELY AFFECT LAKE CHAMPLAIN WATERSHEDS WATER QUALITY, TEACHERS INCREASE TIME SPENT ON INTEGRATING ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION INTO THEIR TEACHING, AND EXPERIENCES WITH THIS UNIQUE TEACHING TOOL OF THE GIANT MAP WILL INSPIRE STUDENTS AND TEACHERS TO DEVELOP THEIR OWN SENSE OF PLACE THAT WILL RESULT IN STEWARDSHIP BEHAVIORS AND ACTIONS THAT SUPPORT THE HEALTH OF THE LAKE CHAMPLAIN WATERSHED AND INCREASE PERSONAL STEWARDSHIP VALUES TOWARD THE LAKE WHICH BENEFIT RESIDENTS IN ADDISON COUNTY .

DESCRIPTION:THIS GRANT AGREEMENT IS BEING AWARDED FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $90,000 TO CAMPUS COMPACT TO IMPLEMENT ITS PROJECT.  THESE FUNDS WILL ASSIST IN THE DESIGN, DEMONSTRATE, AND DISSEMINATE ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION PRACTICES, METHODS, AND TECHNIQUES THAT WILL SERVE TO INCREASE ENVIRONMENTAL LITERACY AND ENCOURAGE BEHAVIOR THAT WILL BENEFIT THE ENVIRONMENT IN MORRILL, HANCOCK, AND LAMOINE, MAINE. THE GRANTEE WILL DO THIS THROUGH EFFORTS TO ADDRESS CLIMATE CHANGE/AIR QUALITY AND ENERGY EFFICIENCY STEWARDSHIP THROUGH PROBLEM-BASED CURRICULUM AND ACTIVITIES FOR MAINE ELEMENTARY SCHOOL STUDENTS (3RD-5TH GRADE) IN UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES.    ACTIVITIES:THIS PROJECT WILL INCREASE PUBLIC AWARENESS AND KNOWLEDGE ABOUT ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES IN LAMOINE, MORRILL, AND HANCOCK, MAINE AND PROVIDE TEACHERS, STUDENTS AND COMMUNITY MEMBERS THE SKILLS NECESSARY TO MAKE INFORMED DECISIONS AND TO TAKE RESPONSIBLE ACTIONS. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED DURING THIS PROJECT PERIOD INCLUDE: FIVE SCHOOL TEAMS THROUGHOUT MAINE, EACH CONSISTING OF A 4TH GRADE TEACHER FROM A DIVERSE, LOW INCOME AREA AND/OR RURAL COMMUNITY PAIRED WITH A PRE-SERVICE COLLEGE STUDENT AND FACULTY ADVISOR TO IMPLEMENT THE RESEARCH-BASED, EE CURRICULUM, CONNECT SCIENCE (CS).  WITH AN EXTENSIVE NETWORK OF COLLEGES AROUND THE STATE, MCC WILL PAIR HIGHER EDUCATION STUDENTS WITH 4TH GRADE TEACHERS TO SUPPORT THE IMPLEMENTATION OF THIS EE CURRICULUM.  EACH TEAM WILL ATTEND A FIVE-DAY CS TRAINING AND IMPLEMENT A 12-WEEK ENERGY UNIT IN THEIR CLASSROOM CULMINATING WITH A STUDENT-LED SERVICE-LEARNING PROJECT. EACH TEAM WILL ORGANIZE AND LEAD AT LEAST ONE EE COMMUNITY EVENT TO PROMOTE ENERGY EFFICIENCY TO THE BROADER COMMUNITY. FINALLY, TEACHERS AND PRE-SERVICE TEACHERS WILL LEAD ONE PROFESSIONAL LEARNING OPPORTUNITY TO SHARE INFORMATION WITH THEIR PEERS AND TO EXPAND THE IMPACTS OF THE ENERGY ME MODEL. OVER 750 MAINERS WILL BE REACHED IN TOTAL.  THE EDUCATIONAL METHODOLOGIES UTILIZED INCLUDE: A FIVE-DAY IN-PERSON/VIRTUAL TRAINING WORKSHOP FOR ENERGY ME TEAM MEMBERS, IMPLEMENTATION OF THE CS CURRICULUM, STUDENT IMPACT ACTIVITIES, CONTINUOUS COACHING FOR TEAMS AS THEY IMPLEMENT CS, COMMUNITY EDUCATION FORUMS LED BY TEAM MEMBERS TO EDUCATE THE PUBLIC.  THIS CURRICULUM WEAVES TOGETHER THREE KEY BRANCHES: SCIENCE CONTENT LEARNING ON PAR WITH NEXT GENERATION SCIENCE STANDARDS (NGSS), STUDENT-DRIVEN SERVICE LEARNING, AND SOCIAL EMOTIONAL LEARNING. SUBRECIPIENT:FIVE TEAMS THROUGHOUT MAINE, EACH CONSISTING OF A 4TH GRADE TEACHER FROM A DIVERSE, LOW INCOME AREA AND/OR RURAL COMMUNITY PAIRED WITH A PRE-SERVICE COLLEGE STUDENT AND FACULTY ADVISOR TO IMPLEMENT THE RESEARCH-BASED, EE CURRICULUM, CONNECT SCIENCE (CS).  AFTER THE 12 WEEK LEARNING PROGRAM IS COMPLETED STUDENTS WILL LEAD A SERVICE LEARNING PROJECT AS A RESULT OF THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:IT IS ANTICIPATED THAT THIS PROJECT WILL RESULT IN THE FOLLOWING DELIVERABLES: AWARENESS OF THE ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION (EE) NEEDS IN THE REGION AND IMPLEMENTATION OF CONNECT SCIENCE LESSON PLANS AND ACTIVITIES, NEW TOOLS TO IMPLEMENT A WIDE RANGE OF CURRICULUM IN NEW AND EFFECTIVE WAYS ON ENERGY AND AIR QUALITY,  AND ADVANCE PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT WITH NEW SCIENCE INSTRUCTION TECHNIQUES FOR EDUCATORS AND PRE-SERVICE TEACHERS.

DESCRIPTION:THIS PROJECT PROVIDES FUNDING TO NEW HAVEN ECOLOGY PROJECT TO IMPLEMENT ITS PROJECT, WHICH WILL DESIGN, DEMONSTRATE, AND DISSEMINATE ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION PRACTICES, METHODS, AND TECHNIQUES, THAT WILL SERVE TO INCREASE ENVIRONMENTAL LITERACY AND ENCOURAGE BEHAVIOR THAT WILL BENEFIT THE ENVIRONMENT IN NEW HAVEN, CONNECTICUT. THE GRANTEE WILL DO THIS BY PLACING 3 HIGHLY SKILLED ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATORS IN 3 PUBLIC SCHOOLS IN NEW HAVEN, PROVIDE PROFESSIONAL SUPPORT TO EXPAND OUTDOOR CLASSROOMS, SCHOOL GARDENS, AND SCHOOL YARD HABITATS CONNECTED TO URBAN WATERS AND LAND, AND CREATE NEW OUTDOOR URBAN ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATIONAL LEARNING EXPERIENCES.

PARTNER ORGANIZATIONS BRING EXPERTISE REGARDING SCIENCE AND STEWARDSHIP IN FORESTED AND AQUATIC ECOSYSTEMS. DESCRIPTION:THIS PROJECT PROVIDES FUNDING TO THE UNIVERSITY OF CONNECTICUT TO IMPLEMENT ITS PROJECT, WHICH WILL DESIGN, DEMONSTRATE, AND DISSEMINATE ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION PRACTICES, METHODS, AND TECHNIQUES, THAT WILL SERVE TO INCREASE ENVIRONMENTAL LITERACY AND ENCOURAGE BEHAVIOR THAT WILL BENEFIT THE ENVIRONMENT IN HARTFORD, BLOOMFIELD, AND WINDHAM, CONNECTICUT. THE GRANTEE WILL DO THIS BY EMPOWERING EDUCATORS AND STUDENTS TO ADDRESS STORMWATER RELATED ISSUES AND GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE WITHIN THEIR COMMUNITIES.  THE UNIVERSITY OF CONNECTICUT NATURAL RESOURCES CONSERVATION ACADEMY WILL TRAIN 20 HIGH SCHOOL TEACHERS THROUGH A PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT WORKSHOP FOCUSED ON STORMWATER MANAGEMENT AND GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE.  ALSO, STUDENTS WITH EDUCATOR SUPPORT WILL PLAN AND IMPLEMENT LOCAL PROJECTS FOCUSED ON STORMWATER MANAGEMENT AND GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE.  THIS PROJECT TARGETS LOW INCOME AREAS AND COMMUNITIES THAT CONTAIN TITLE I SCHOOLS. THIS PROGRAM WILL PROVIDE EDUCATORS FROM UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES WITH RESOURCES AND INSTRUCTION AS THEY CARRY OUT CUSTOMIZED WATERSHED-BASED LESSONS, LEVERAGING NEXT GENERATION SCIENCE STANDARDS-DESIGNED CURRICULUM CREATED BY THE PROJECT TEAM, IN THEIR CLASSROOMS. ACTIVITIES:THIS PROJECT WILL INCREASE STUDENT AND PUBLIC AWARENESS AND KNOWLEDGE ABOUT ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES IN HARTFORD, BLOOMFIELD, AND WINDHAM, CONNECTICUT AND PROVIDE STUDENTS, TEACHERS, AND COMMUNITY MEMBERS THE SKILLS NECESSARY TO MAKE INFORMED DECISIONS AND TO TAKE RESPONSIBLE ACTIONS. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED DURING THIS PROJECT PERIOD INCLUDE: APPROXIMATELY 600 HIGH SCHOOL STUDENTS WILL USE A WATERSHED-MODELING WEB APP TO ANALYZE LAND USE AND SOIL DATA IN THEIR NEIGHBORHOODS, MODEL STORMWATER RUNOFF AND WATER-QUALITY IMPACTS, AND COMPARE HOW DIFFERENT CONSERVATION OR DEVELOPMENT SCENARIOS COULD MODIFY RUNOFF AND WATER QUALITY. WORKING WITH UNDERGRADUATE CORPS, PARTICIPATING PARTNER SCHOOL TEAMS WILL THEN BE GUIDED THROUGH PLANNING AND IMPLEMENTING LOCAL GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE PROJECTS EITHER ON THEIR SCHOOL PROPERTY OR IN THE NEARBY COMMUNITY. THE KEY ACTIVITY WILL BE THE CREATION, IMPLEMENTATION, AND EVALUATION OF A TWO-DAY STORMWATER MANAGEMENT AND GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT WORKSHOP FOR HIGH SCHOOL TEACHERS MODELED OFF THE SUCCESSFUL USDA-FUNDED NRCA TEACHER PROFESSIONAL LEARNING PROGRAM FOLLOWED BY SERVICE LEARNING COMMUNITY PROJECTS. TRAIN 20 SECONDARY EDUCATORS TO IMPLEMENT STORMWATER MANAGEMENT AND GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE CURRICULUM DURING A TWO-DAY PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT WORKSHOP.

#8729; TEACH, VIA EDUCATOR PARTICIPANTS, UP TO 600 HIGH SCHOOL STUDENTS ABOUT ENVIRONMENTAL CAREER OPTIONS AND PATHWAYS.
#8729; SUPPORT HUNDREDS OF STUDENTS, TEACHERS AND COMMUNITY MEMBERS AS THEY CARRY OUT LOCAL GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE ENVIRONMENTAL PROJECTS.
#8729; DETERMINE THE IMPACTS OF THE CURRICULUM AND GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE PROJECTS ON HIGH SCHOOL STUDENTS' ENVIRONMENTAL LITERACY AND CAREER INTERESTS.OUTCOMES:IT IS ANTICIPATED THAT THIS PROJECT WILL RESULT IN THE FOLLOWING DELIVERABLES: STORMWATER MANAGEMENT CURRICULAR, EDUCATOR TRAINING, AND GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE PROJECTS AT SCHOOLS IN UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES. DESCRIPTION:THIS PROJECT PROVIDES FUNDING TO SEA RESEARCH FOUNDATION D/B/A MYSTIC AQUARIUM TO IMPLEMENT ITS PROJECT, WHICH WILL DESIGN, DEMONSTRATE, AND DISSEMINATE ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION PRACTICES, METHODS, AND TECHNIQUES, THAT WILL SERVE TO INCREASE ENVIRONMENTAL LITERACY AND ENCOURAGE BEHAVIOR THAT WILL BENEFIT THE ENVIRONMENT IN NEW LONDON, CONNECTICUT. ACTIVITIES:THIS PROJECT WILL INCREASE PUBLIC AWARENESS AND KNOWLEDGE ABOUT ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES IN NEW LONDON, CONNECTICUT AND PROVIDE STUDENTS THE SKILLS NECESSARY TO MAKE INFORMED DECISIONS AND TO TAKE RESPONSIBLE ACTIONS. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED DURING THIS PROJECT PERIOD INCLUDE: KNOWLEDGE AND EXPERIENCES TO PRESERVE AND ADVANCE WATERSHED AND HABITAT HEALTH, WATER POLLUTION PREVENTION, AQUACULTURE AND SUSTAINABLE LANDSCAPING.  THE STUDENTS WILL SHADOW STAFF AT MYSTIC AQUARIUM/CAREER MENTORS AND ATTEND PRESENTATIONS BY EXPERTS IN THEIR FIELD ON THESE TOPIC AREAS.  STUDENTS WILL MAKE PRESENTATIONS AT THE END OF THE PROGRAM ON THEIR EXPERIENCES AND UNDERSTANDING IN THE THREE TOPIC AREAS. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE THE STUDENTS THAT ARE PARTICIPATING THIS EDUCATIONAL PROGRAM.

THE ECOLOGY SCHOOL &LDQUO;FOOD FOR THOUGHT&RDQUO; (FFT) PROGRAM WILL EDUCATE LOCAL SCHOOL CHILDREN (GRADES 4-8), THEIR CLASSROOM TEACHERS AND PARENTS, AND THE COMMUNITY ON FOOD ISSUES RELATED TO CONSERVATION AND SUSTAINABILITY.  FOLLOWING 20 YEARS OF SUCCESS, THE FFT PROGRAM WILL EDUCATE 805 STUDENTS FROM 13 PARTNER SCHOOLS  OVER THE TWO YEAR PROJECT PERIOD BEGINNING IN JUNE 2021.  50% OF PARTICIPATING SCHOOLS ARE CLASSIFIED AS LOW-INCOME BASED ON THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION&RSQUO;S TITLE I PROGRAM. FFT IS A NEW ENGLAND-FOCUSED ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION PROGRAM THAT INCREASES STUDENTS&RSQUO; AWARENESS OF AGRICULTURAL ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES INCLUDING, AMONG OTHER ISSUES, HOW TO MANAGE FOOD WASTE; COMPOSTING IN ORDER TO REDUCE LANDFILL VOLUME; USING COVER CROPS TO PREVENT TOPSOIL EROSION; AND USING AN INTEGRATED PEST MANAGEMENT SYSTEM THAT REDUCES PESTICIDE RUNOFF INTO RIVERS AND STREAMS, THUS KEEPING WATER SYSTEMS CLEAN AND FRESH. THE STUDENTS PARTICIPATING IN FFT WILL LEARN THE CONNECTIONS BETWEEN FOOD, PEOPLE, AND THE ENVIRONMENT THROUGH RESIDENTIAL ATTENDANCE OR DAY LONG LEARNING EXPERIENCES.  WITH FFT, A GOAL IS FOR ELEMENTARY AND MIDDLE SCHOOL STUDENTS FROM SOUTHERN MAINE AND NORTHERN NEW ENGLAND TO INCORPORATE SUSTAINABLE AGRICULTURE TECHNIQUES, HEALTHY FOOD SYSTEMS, AND RESPONSIBLE CONSERVATION INTO THEIR LIVES.

THE UNIVERSITY OF VERMONT & STATE AGRICULTURAL COLLEGE (UVTSAC) BUILDS ENVIRONMENTAL LITERACY AS IT RELATES TO AGRICULTURAL PRODUCTION AMONG FUTURE FARMERS AND THE EDUCATORS THAT WORK IN THIS FIELD.  THE PROJECT DEVELOPS RESEARCH-BASED CURRICULUM ON RESPONSIBLE AGRICULTURE MANAGEMENT TO MINIMIZE IMPACT ON WATER RESOURCES BY REDUCING NUTRIENT RUN-OFF FROM SOIL, MAKE CURRICULUM WIDELY ACCESSIBLE TO AGRICULTURAL EDUCATORS AND STUDENTS, AND RECEIVE INDUSTRY RECOGNIZED CREDENTIALS FOR THE CURRICULUM FROM THE VERMONT AGENCY OF EDUCATION.  THE CURRICULUM EDUCATES AND PREPARES FUTURE FARMERS TO MEET THE REQUIRED AGRICULTURAL PRACTICES (RAPS) PASSED BY THE 2015 CLEAN WATER ACT FOR VERMONT ON LAKE CHAMPLAIN'S WATER QUALITY.  THIS PROJECT TARGETS 17 CAREER AND TECHNICAL CENTERS ACROSS THE STATE AND 6 PUBLIC HIGH SCHOOLS ' REACHING OVER 30 AGRICULTURAL EDUCATORS AND 350 HIGH SCHOOL STUDENTS.

THIS PROJECT CREATES WASTE REDUCTION, DIVERSION, AND RECYCLING EDUCATIONAL PROGRAM FOR PROVIDENCE RESIDENTS AND STUDENTS.  THIS PROJECT PARTNERS WITH PROVIDENCE SCHOOLS ON WASTE REDUCTION EDUCATION TO PROMOTE RECYCLING, COMPOSTING, AND REDUCING SINGLE-USE PLASTIC WASTE WHICH SUPPORT THE CITY'S ZERO WASTE GOALS AND PRIORITIES.  5,000 REUSABLE BAGS ARE DISTRIBUTED THROUGH LOCAL BUSINESS AND ORGANIZATION PARTNERS AS PART OF THE PROGRAM.  STUDENTS ALSO CREATE ART PROJECTS THAT RAISE PUBLIC AWARENESS ON WASTE ISSUES.  OVER 1300 STUDENTS TOUR RI ONLY ACTIVE LANDFILL TO GAIN DIRECT EDUCATION ON WASTE SEPARATION/REUSE/REDUCTION.  ADULTS ARE EDUCATED IN WASTE REDUCTION WITH THE GOAL OF REDUCING THE NUMBER OF CONTAMINATED RECYCLING LOADS BY 50% FROM TARGETED NEIGHBORHOODS.  THE HARVEST CYCLE FOOD SCRAP COLLECTION PROGRAM EXPECTS TO EXPAND TO 75 IN TARGET NEIGHBORHOODS DIVERTING THOUSANDS OF POUNDS OF ORGANIC WASTE FROM THE LANDFILL. PROMOTING EDUCATION THROUGH ACTION FOR CONSERVATION OF HABITATS (PEACH) EDUCATES BOSTON AREA RESIDENTS (500 VOLUNTEERS-YOUTH AND ADULTS) ON HABITAT RESTORATION OPPORTUNITIES. NEW ENGLAND AQUARIUM PARTNERS WITH 5-7 LOCAL ENVIRONMENTAL ORGANIZATIONS TO BUILD CAPACITY THROUGH TRAININGS FOR THEIR STAFF MEMBER AND IN TURN OFFER VOLUNTEERS ORIENTATION PROGRAMS TO MANAGE HABITAT RESTORATION AND CITIZEN SCIENCE PROJECTS. THE PROJECT IS FOCUSED TOWARD HABITAT AREAS THAT ARE PART OF LOCAL WATERSHEDS THAT CAN HELP TO PROTECT WATER RESOURCES AND REDUCE HARMFUL INPUTS TO AREA STREAMS AND RIVERS FLOWING TO BOSTON HARBOR AND MASSACHUSETTS BAY. MANY OF THE PARTNER ORGANIZATIONS HAVE INITIATED SOME HABITAT RESTORATION PROJECTS. THIS FUNDING ALLOWS FOR EXPANSION AND MORE IN DEPTH EDUCATION ON WATERSHEDS AND WATER QUALITY.
